Reviews.Title: “would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Joseph R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean room, but ground floor and noisy, right on pavement. Breakfast poor - it was obvious the cheapest foods had been sourced.

Reviews.Title: “tatty”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: is a very expensive for the service they give. The breakfast is not worth anything, in the room can hear everything.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here at the Belfort”
Reviews.Author: TERESA M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to a number of varying locations in Europe and American/Mexico. This was the poorest accommodation for the money paid. The double bed did not have a double duvet it had to mismatched singles. The light above the bed had bare wires showing and the shower basin was so disgusting that I washed at the sink and had shower when we moved onto next destination. This was a trip to celebrate my husband's fiftieth birthday and I was lucky that I had not booked my whole stay here. The hotel is on an extremely noisy road and my husband did not sleep due to the sirens at all hours of the night. The room was very small but that is to be expected when travelling to Amsterdam. This was not my first trip to Amsterdam and I will be returning but will not ever stay here again even if it was free others may if the price was in the forty pounds a night and not the 95 euro's that I was charged.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Jill998
Reviews.Content: We were sold this accommodation through Thomson who actually recommended it!! There are actually only two floors of 'accommodation' (I cannot call it a 'hotel' the rest is a run down derelect block of flats on the outskirts of the town on a very busy road in the middle of nowhere. How many coats of paint can be added to woodchip wallpaper? NO WAY is this a 3* 'hotel' - the photos on the website must have been taken over 20+ years ago. The place was terrible. There was a crack in our basin and no plug, the shower head was tied up with a piece of black wool. The floor in our bedroom was actually falling away. The windows were so dirty you could not see out of them. We had a single thin quilt covering two single beds that had been pushed together (they called it a double room)! The reception was coverd in building tools, dirty lined ... I could go on for ever ---DO NOT STAY THERE - WHAT A DUMP - and the fact that Thompson recommended it - I will never book through them again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: There was not alot of things that were good or even ok about this place. The rooms were run down, the breakfast was poor - I got a mouldy peice of bread. The service was average and the location was not great, it takes atleast 15 minutes via tram to get into the centre of Amsterdam and at the price we paid it just didn't make the grade.

Reviews.Title: “A horrible venue”
Reviews.Author: PeterinUK
Reviews.Content: Shabby and torn curtains, broken furniture and mirror, broken shower and toilet. A real disgrace. Even if these had been fixed, the hotel is simply not a 3 star. You could buy drinks at the bar, but had to take them to your room to consume them. The room was on the ground floor, overlooking a busy junction and an even busier reception (the receptionist seemed to enjoy chatting all night long). Shabby, shabby, shabby. You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: LadyM33
Reviews.Content: me and 2 friends were meant to be staying for a 4 night break and we were informed it was near the center and a 3* there is NO WAY it is a 3*, we were given a room which was right next to the reception it was tiny, filthy, i would go as far to say i wouldn't even wash a dog in the bath, there was a hole in the wall and the triple room was 3 single beds which were so close together you would have to side step between them and there was a tiny single wandrobe in the corner and nowhere else to put anything, we went to reception to complain and the lady was very short and rude giving us a key to the room next door which i would say was even worse than previous room, bed was broken, lights hanging off wall. In the end we checked straight back out and paid to stay somewhere else and are now fighting to get our money back.... When you look at the hotel from the outside it looks like the 1st floor upwards is either bedsits or hostel as there is sheets up at the windows and people stuff on the balcony like wind chimes etc, plus there are 2 doors at the front of the hotel one which goes into reception and one which we didnt enter but presume it goes to the accomodation upstairs. The dining room was filthy and flies everywhere, all i suggest is DO NOT BOOK TO STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “not 3 star”
Reviews.Author: suexphil
Reviews.Content: i agree with the comments of 29/9/11, we were there a few days later. sat - tue the hotel is quite nosiy next to a busy junction with thin walls and windows, plus woken 3am every night by other guests. sunday breakfast bread roll was mouldy! woman in charge never seemed happy. THE ROOM;- double bed was 2 singles with a very soft double mattress on top, bedding was 2 single duvets and sheets!1 small in wall cupboard, 2 small drawers, a desk and 2 chairs didn't leave much room to move. the room wasn't cleaned on the sunday just re made the bed. full clean on monday. overall we would say the hotel was somewhere to sleep not much else, the rooms look exactly the same as the 2007 photos!

Reviews.Title: “If I had been in Amsterdam again, I wouldn't definitely stay there.”
Reviews.Author: Mertstrip
Reviews.Content: The first time we went, the woman in reception gave us the worst room althought there are too many empty rooms.We changed 4 rooms(It was difficult).There was no room service.The rooms smell bad and the "place" we had breakfast.The bathroom was useless and too dirty.I couldn't find any good ways about the hotel.The receptionists treadted us like we are animals that waiting for getting milked.I regret not staying at the street.At least there were less bugs there.Actually I wouldn't rate this hotel even "terrible".

Reviews.Title: “Definately not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: LondonerEurope
Reviews.Content: It is surely not a 3 star hotel . They do not even have a cloak room to keep your luggage. We reached an hour early than check-in time and were asked to leave our luggage in a corridor which was very narrow and already filled with several luggages !!! Also there is no locker /safe in the room. With the beds in the room you barely have place to move.Not to forget, the beds have wheels!!! yes it moves when u sit on it :) Not sure why would one have beds with wheels unless it is a hospital .Breakfast not great, not many options . The corridors are dark and dingy, curtains in the room stained. Walls are not painted for years. And there is a open restaurant just outside (non functional), which looks like it has not been used for years. Overall not a pleasant experience. The only advantage is it is a stones throw away from the tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING, UNCLEAN, UNSAFE - DO NOT STAY HERE OR THE OMEGA”
Reviews.Author: burkink
Reviews.Content: To our surprise, when we arrived to our booked Omega hotel, the very unfriendly hotel clerk informed us that we had been double booked and therefore had to be taken to another hotel across the city, after the had already processed my visa and taken our money. After an unmarked taxi drove us to out next destination, we arrived at "Hotel Belfort" located on a highway in a neighborhood neither of us felt safe in. Once we check in, with yet again a rude staff member, we discovered the following problems: - the sheets and pillow cases were filthy (with the pillow case in particular having a large piece of snot and blood on it); - There was no lock for the inside of the door, and the door did not shut all the way - we had to sleep with a chair propped up against it; - The telephone was not functioning and we had no way of calling anyone in case of emergency; - The smoke alarms went off in the night twice as we realized other guests were smoking cigarettes and drugs in the next room of this non smoking hotel; - Although we were sleeping in a double bed, the bedding was only for a single bed and could not keep us warm in the night; - After asking for a wake up call, we did not receive any kind of call/knock/alarm and nearly missed our train back to Paris. After my Mother and I expressed our serious concerns about the safety and cleanliness of this hotel, the owner of both the Omega and Belfort treated us with disrespect and insincerity.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job, but expect no service with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: m4rkym4rk
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying out of the city centre as it got me to use the tram, once you know how to use them (and it is very easy) it makes staying away from the city centre a joy. Staff were miserable, didn't smile once or say goodbye, polite engaging customer service costs nothing but I've never stayed at a hotel where the staff are so cold. I paid Â£336 for 3 nights accomodation and a return flight from teesside and that included the single room supliment which aint bad. I'd recommend it but would'nt say to go out of your way to stay there it's nothing special but not awful either.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, but wouldn't do it again”
Reviews.Author: Elsoueidi
Reviews.Content: Great thing about the hotel was that it is located right by the tram station. that was excellent. you can't miss it. The room and bathroom were clean, but old. Beds were comfortable but the sheets weren't fitted so at night they were everywhere but covering the mattress :S Staff were helpful but a bit bold. Breakfast was tasty but very limited. It was a home made breakfast not a hotel breakfast (toast, boiled eggs, honey, jam, butter, ham, cheese, and turkey breast slices) Hotel has a few restaurants around it, there is pub around the corner but no take away menu, and there is a great pizza place about 5 mins away. It was definately a good stay for the three days we were there, but I wouldn't go for the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap hotel ... in every way!”
Reviews.Author: teo215
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friends in this hotel because it was rather cheap and according to the advertisement it is 10min away from the central station. When we entered the hotel we had to leave our luggage in an open room (a 2m by 2m room), and because there were other luggage in the room there was no space for ours. then after we went in the room we found that we had no ventilation, no lift, no remote control and most of all no telephone!! The wardrobe was for one person and we were 4 in the room! some lights and furniture were missing also. And for the gran finale... if you want breakfast be there at 7am or else you wont find anything left because they wont replace and bread etc.. Well if you think you can live without these necessities, well then go to BELFORT!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ProfYaffle
Reviews.Content: Shamelessly awful hotel. Can't really add much to others' comments except to repeat their recommendation to avoid this place at all costs. BTW why doesn't TripAdvisor aggregate the ratings? That would tell you straight away that places like the Belfort are to be avoided. As it is you have to wade through several pages and work out the average in your head.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a three start hotel.”
Reviews.Author: onthemovemom
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for myself and our two teenagers when we were stranded in Amsterdam during the volcanic ash airport closure. He did not read the reviews. The number of our room was written on a scrap of paper and taped to the door. The beds were an Ikea style bunk bed with very thin mattresses. The room smelled damp and of old food. There were small windows near the ceiling which appeared filthy and were covered with paper. Rubbish was floating in the toilet. The room was generally nasty and I did not feel safe. The receptionist offered to show us another room but we bailed and booked another hotel. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced Hostel at Best”
Reviews.Author: biffstur
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a dump - poor service, unsanitary, and dangerous (guests were mugged on the terrace at breakfast). I can't say enough how I would steer clear of this hotel and Expedia's lack of effort to back their client up in getting us out of our reservation.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hippo1948
Reviews.Content: Staff hostile, what few there where! I could count the numbers on one hand! And how it can call itself a hotel? Nowhere to hang clothes, shower bracket falling off the wall as well as the loo roll holder and despite requests to fix - no one bothered. Breakfast was appalling - one tea bag in a large jug, no fruit or yoghurt. We had to request they clean our room. Place was a disgrace! Hotel not as depicted on the website. Hairdryer not working - no replacement offered, power sockets in room 109 very dodgy! We were three ladies staying and given bunk beds to sleep in! Ceiling had damp stains, couldn't open windows so very hot, sticky and steamy from the bathroom. We spent as little time as possible in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and not very cheerful”
Reviews.Author: captk2071
Reviews.Content: A group of us stay at the Belfort for 3 nights in April '09. We did not book this hotel ourselves but trusted the travel agent. Big mistake! The property is nothing like the photos used to promote the hotel. They must have been taken 20 years ago! The rooms we stayed in were even more run down than the ones shown in the member's photos. 3 of us stayed in a triple room and it was a twin room with another single bed jammed in between the two singles with barely enough room to around the solid square of beds. There was no desk and no phone. 3 tall windows to one side but none of them can be opened and no air conditioning so we were giving thanks that it was not high summer when we stayed there. Everything was worn and smelt of decay. Some upstairs room have strong odour of cigarette smoke even though the rooms are suppose to be smoke free. The bathroom was clean and reasonably spacious and has a functional hair dryer. One member of our group reported that his bathroom has no shower screen so that water was splashing everywhere. There is suppose to be a restaurant but we have never seem a meal being served there but you can get drinks from the bar and the price is reasonable. A typical continental breakfast is served there each morning. Some staff were okay but others were less than helpful. One Dutch friend told us that some staff can barely speak Dutch and English is not much better so we are not sure what is the preferred language. The #4 trams runs next to the hotel and it is about a 15mins ride into the city. There were other issues so let's just say that you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “avoid at any cost”
Reviews.Author: emile2007
Reviews.Content: simple- it's dirty, unfriendly, whatever you pay for it is absurd. I feel sorry for the employees who have to deal with all the complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be misled by their website!”
Reviews.Author: Aby-Bubs
Reviews.Content: Please dont be misled by the images on the website for this hotel... the glamorous entrance is just a beam that happend to be there as an architecture for an appartment building... The hotel in fact is located in an appartment building and take the lower three floors of it... The staff makes you feel as though they are doing you a favor by letting you stay and throw instructions at you from the moment you step in... Every morning you will be woken up by the housekeeping yelling and talking amonst themselves in the corridor... I stayed there for 2 nights... and pehaps the worst from my hotel travel experience... On the first morning the housekeeping open the door and walked in while I was getting ready... The hotel breakfast is just terrible and a bare formality of the lowest quality... There is a terrible smell in the room and the full hotel in general... I wold not suggest anyone for this hotel... The Chinese family running the hotel is non friendly and replyies your questions in a tone as though they are annoyed to have you there... No thank you's - just plain instructions is all you get...

Reviews.Title: “dont do it”
Reviews.Author: jojosouthyorkshire
Reviews.Content: Yes i had read the reviews but thuought could a hotel of 3 * status be so bad ?? No it was much worse ! The room was so tiny dingy and smelly, odd stains on both bed bases, dirt and blood smeered on the walls wires hanging down in the smallest dirtiest bathroom in the world, i was totally gutted ! I had taken my boyfriend for his 40th birthday as a treat but spent 3 days saying sorry !! The hall ways, carpets stairs filthy i could go on and on, the best advise i could give is DONT STAY AT THE BELFORT, the breakfast that was included didnt make up for the dirty place we had to sleep at all as other reviewers said you can still smoke in pub there so if dont smoke you ended up eating more smoke than toast! Amsterdam is a wonderful place with so so much to see and do we will go back agian no doubt but i would rather stay in the gutter again than the belfort.

Reviews.Title: “Neat & tidy but TINY”
Reviews.Author: ÐšÐ¾Ñ‚ÐµÐ½Ð¾Ðº
Reviews.Content: The Belfort Hotel was cheap, clean, tidy. If this is your only criteria, you may well love this hotel. Despite what other reviewers have said, I had no problem with the location - there is a tram stop just across the road. It was well heated in the cold begining of winter. The bed and pillows were also nice and comfy (I like reasonably soft beds). The bed was made at least once a day, the towels changed and bathroom cleaned. No complaints there. However, the room was tiny. I mean REALLY tiny. It was hard to squeeze by the bed against the wall where the (very nice LCD) TV was mounted without tripping up or banging my shins, and I'm a very slim woman in my early 20s! But honestly, the size of the room wasn't a big concern for us. The other thing I thought to mention, is that there is no lift in this hotel, only stairs. So if, like me, you are travelling with a suitcase that weighs as much as you do - try to book the lowest floor down. I was silly and didn't realise that many budget - midrange hotels in Europe do not feature lifts. Also, there was a bucks party staying on our floor, they didn't keep us awake with noise (I think they were out most of the night!), but during the afternoon I suspect they smoked a fair bit of weed, judging by the smell in the hallway. I'm not saying to anyone that they should count on being allowed to do it there, or that anyone should avoid the hotel on that experience - but perhaps if this behaviour would bother you, make polite enquiries as to the guests on your floor before you accept your check in room? The breakfast spread was ok - couple of different types of breads, cereals, pastries, tea and coffee, juices etc. Nothing to rave about but nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Very sketchy”
Reviews.Author: Monaco98
Reviews.Content: Was it cheap, and clean? Yes, but that's about all I can say for the Belfort. A bit too far out of town, with ancient, vile carpets and wall-hangings, the place is gloomy and not well kept. The rooms are tiny--even by European standards. I've stayed in nicer dormitories, and that's what this place felt like. It is farther out of the city center than I was led to beleive--a 15-20 minute tram-ride, althought service is quick and efficient on these throughout Amsterdam. Too far to walk unless you are in NO hurry, via the Vondelpark on a nice day maybe. But iit s also a short taxi (32-euros!) ride to the airport too. The room was noisy, as were the rather eclectic characters among my fellow clients, some of whom seemed to be there only for, ahem, very short stays. I slept with earplugs and still had difficulty getting any rest. Breakfast was about what you'd expect: coffee, juices, breads and cold-cuts. In short, you can do better elsewhere--and should. If you do get stuck here for whatever reason, try nearby bars called The Bridge, and Cafe Oslo. Both were busy with a fun, mixed crowd.

Reviews.Title: “nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: munchkin969
Reviews.Content: hotel was ok, some staff good others not so much. Location was outside of the city, however that was what we were after as we did want to meet local people. Great access to town and little cafes in the area. No ac in the room so it made it pretty hot, but tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: americanindijon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not in the heart of Amsterdam, but it wasn't too far from it. It was an easy walk to some of the busiest squares for going out at night. It was clean and comfortable, but nothing spectacular. There were a few burn marks, probably from smokers, but I guess that's to be expected in Amsterdam. The free breakfast was decent, and at least it was free, a rarity in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean hotel in an OK location”
Reviews.Author: alchemista
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions on the hotel were poor. It was in a not so great area, the building itself looked a bit shabby. Things got a little better walking inside. The front desk staff was neither friendly nor unfriendly, they did hold our bags but kept them right behind the desk which was usually not manned, so it didn't feel very safe to leave the bags there (we took out everything of value). Early check-in was not possible. Inside, the rooms were very spartan, but clean. The shower had some rust stains so we did not shower on our night there. The hotel was not in the best of areas, but there is a tram stop right outside. The room consisted of just two twin beds and a LCD TV, but that was about all. The beds were comfortable though, with a nice heavy duvet on top. From the airport, go to the closer Amsterdam Lelylaan station instead of Amsterdam Central, it will save you time and money. From there, take a tram to the Surinameplein stop and the hotel is on one of the corners of the square. We only stayed at this hotel because it was the only decent one available on the first night we went. We had already decided to change hotels the next nights. Since it was a busy night, the hotel was 119 euros, which we felt was too expensive for this hotel. If we had to repeat, we would choose a better hotel in this price range. Around 70-80 euros would probably be a good value for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: HARRYTHEB
Reviews.Content: this is the first time i have written a review but feel compelled. i visit amsterdam at least once a year and like to try different hotels. this is by far the worse,it has a poor and unattractive location. the room was tiny,you were just able to walk around the bed. the bed was so uncomfortable we struggled to get any sleep. it was clean. i cannot believe this is a three star hotel,how did this pass? we even tried to get another hotel for the second night even though we had already paid in full that's how bad this experience was!

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: villasis
Reviews.Content: i just came back from my holiday commencing january 26 ,our first stop was amsterdam and we stayed in this hotel ,we booked triple bed,the location was excellent with tram,quite environment,nice foods for bed and breakfast,nice service,reception staff are approachable and helpful,the only problem was the room given to us 1 double deck bed and single bed and that room was in between the other rooms for groups,unfortunately for the first 2 nights the 2 other rooms was with lads (4 each rooms)they made our nights horrible due to banging of doors(unconsiderate)what a coincidence they come from england,drunk as usual going back to their rooms at 2-4 am,though its not the hotels fault,i will recommend this hotel to my friends in the future due mainly to location,to other people going to holiday be considerate to fellow guest.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers-eat ur heart out!!”
Reviews.Author: matildalou
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Fawlty Towers or Faulty Towers. When we were there have of the building was being done up, it looked a mess from the outside. i would not recommend this hotel. The only good thing about the hotel is that the tram stop was right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: Shazjak
Reviews.Content: I had already booked this hotel when I read the reviews, my first reaction was what have I done. When we arrived and entered our room I was pleasently suprised after all the bad reviews that we had read. The room and the beds were spotlessly clean, the room was cleaned every day that we were there. The hotel although not in the centre has fantastic transport links to the city centre. The only downside we found was if you are not an early riser you will miss out on breakfast, they only seem to place the food out once, when this has gone it is not replaced. The bar is also not fully stocked if you are a shorts drinker. If you want something basic cheap and clean I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly and loud, but clean room”
Reviews.Author: bender103
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an ugly high rise apartment building which looks quite eastern europe style. There is no airconditioning and the proximity of a big street makes opening the windows a very loud experience. The room at least was clean, had a flat screen TV and it looked like it had just been renovated. The drain in the shower was a bit slow, but in general the room was ok for the price. Breakfast buffet included coffee, juices, rolls and a selection of toppings. I would propably stay there again but just because it is comparatively cheap.

Reviews.Title: “small but warm place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel with my friends for 2 days. it is small not like what we have expected, it is more like a family hotel. There are two trams go into the center. It is a bit far away but still convinient. There is only one receptionist in duty, and indeed they are very helpful but too busy with other works. The breakfast is still ok with lots choices. Except all, only the price of the room is a little bit high.

Reviews.Title: “do not touch this hotel”
Reviews.Author: debzie
Reviews.Content: ........not even with a barge pole. We were led up a grubby staircase to our floor. There was no lift. The corridor stunk of smoke. Our room had a big brown stain above the bed head. The toilet smelled damp, the room smelt musty. The lighting was fluorescent strip lighting. There were big ugly pictures on the wall that looked cheap. We told management that we were not satisfied. We were taken to a room across the corridor. This was just the same except it had a slightly better picture.The furniture was chipped. The shower was loose, the grip holding the floor covering was also loose. We got into bed carefully thinking it would collapse as it was very rickety. The tv was a portable on a wall bracket. No sky tv, just terrestrial dutch speaking programmes. Disgusted and embarrassed as this was part of my partner's birthday present. How is this a three star hotel?

Reviews.Title: “The Most Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler. I have to say this is the worst hotel that I every stayed at. The room is like a hospital room except the room is VERY dirty. The furniture is full of dust. The table were the TV is on is an old computer table. I had to wiggle the cable on the back of the television to get a clear picture. The bed is uncomfortable and small. Bathroom is dark and unclean. I had to go to the front desk to ask for information about the train and the area but the front desk personnel act like I was bothering her. The staff was not friendly at all. The location of the hotel is not very convenient at all. This hotel does not even deserve a one star. The price of the room is totally not worth it. Even if the room is free, I would not recommend it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently had to stay here for one night during the queen's birthday celebration because it was one of the only hotels available. I was surprised that this hotel was rated 3 stars. It was extremely overpriced. The rooms looked like old hospital rooms, the beds were uncomfortable, the bathroom was not very clean, the shower door did not close and there was dust on all of the furniture. The door to the room did not close without slamming it and there wasn't a double lock on the door. The staff was very unfriendly. We did not have towels in our room and finally, after asking multiple times, had to go get them. They were very reluctant to give us more than one towel. We did not stay for the breakfast and left as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: HullLidds
Reviews.Content: My god what a dump, 3 star no way. Bedrooms were disgusting, stained toilets with broken seat, shower flooded,stains all over the walls, old fashion metal windows with no double glazing. The hotel is situated next to a main road. Only stayed one night, thank god, this is one hotel tell your friends about. Find another one is my recommadation.

Reviews.Title: “An awful hovel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shazbot79
Reviews.Content: The hotel (The Belfort) surely cannot be rated as 3 star. The hotel was dirty, staff were exceptionally unhelpful, often going out of their way to be unhelpful, miserable and rude. I was in a party of 13 and all of the rooms were in a dreadful state. 2 of the rooms were in the basement (including my own) were flooded and stank of sewage and mould. The whole of the basement corridor was running with an inch of water. We asked to change rooms and were flattly told no with no chance to discuss the matter. My own bathroom toilet was blocked and when flushed the contents came up through the bath and sink. There was evidence of fire damage in my bathroom and the toilet seat was in two pieces. The shower leaked and when used the bathroom flooded to a considerable degree. The whole hotel was a joke from start to finish. There were massive holes in the corridor walls. There was no heating in my room and the double bed had two single duvets on it so myself and my companion were freezing during the night. It was a truly awful experience. Even if the hotel hadn't been flooded it would still not warrant 3 stars, it is threadbare and run down and the staff are appalling. I cannot emphasise enough how truly terrible the hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “don't waste your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: blwitch
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this 'hotel' for a week. Service was terrible, staff were grumpy and very unpolite. the room was so small that we hardly managed to move around. they put us in a room for 2 and got two other beds from some other room. no room service and prices for drinks were doubled in price. a soft drink was priced at 3Euro. you can buy drinks from outside the hotel for l.60 euro. bed sheets were never changed during that week and room was never cleaned. breakfast consisted of bread, 3 different cold cuts and juices so you better be early at the breakfast table otherwise they do not re-stock. first come, first served basis at breakfast. I strongly recommend to find another hotel rather than staying at the Belfort.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting dirty hole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. We stayed as a group of 6 and paid alot for the hotel for what it was. The lobby was scruffy and dingey as so were the rooms, curtain rails hanging from the walls, there were cavities in the walls in which had been stuffed with plastic carrier bags, the bedding was filfthy as were the carpets and furniture, I asked for a refund to pay for another hotel and they blaintently refused, I asked for clean bedding they didnt have any, so we had to stick it for 2 dreadful nights. We went down for breakfast in plenty of time and there was nothing left to eat, we asked the owner for more food and he conveniently didnt understand English (we had to buy breakfast out). It was a hole and I would reccommend that you dont go anywhere near this disgusting hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A little out of town....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time in Amsterdam and the people we were travelling with were on a strict budget, so we had to go for a cheaper hotel. The Belfort was definitely what I would class as an "Economy" hotel. The rooms are small and very basic, but spotlessly clean. The Hotel can be reached by trams 1 and 17 from Centraal Station. The number 1 is the more direct route. I found the hotel a little too far out of town for my liking, as I prefer to be more central. The walls were paper thin and if someone was watching TV until 4am (like our next door neighbour), this can be very annoying. The hotel is also on a very busy main road (Surneimaplein) and traffic and tram noise WILL awake you very early! The breakfast is very basic, with cheese some cold meats, bread, juice, coffee and tea. There is one breville toastie machine. For the price, this is a clean and pretty good value hotel. I would advise buying either a 15 trip stripkarten ticket for about 6 euros or an unlimited all-public transport ticket. We bought the 48 hour one for 10 euros and it saved us a fortune! You will trams and buses from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a few days”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in August, midweek. A bit out from city centre, however the Amsterdam tram service is excellent and there is a stop 1 minute from the hotel. If you get a number 1, it takes about 15 mins to Dam Square. The hotel itself is clean and the reception staff are very helpful. It is pretty noisy however, being next to a main road and crossroads, so if you want an early night you have no chance until after about 12.30am when the trams and traffic dies down. Breakfast is basic but OK. On the whole, good value if you don't intend spending much time in the hotel. There is also a small bistro / bar next to the hotel. The food there is excellent and great value.

Reviews.Title: “The Belfort Hotel: a good economical choice for those spending a weekend in Amst”
Reviews.Author: Roscommongirl
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed in the Belfort Hotel in June of this year. We found it fine for a weekend in Amsterdam. There are very good tram connections to and from the city centre and it is also very easy to get to and from Schiphol airport. However, the trams stop running at around 12.30 at night so you must get a taxi back to the hotel if you have a night on the town. Taxis are relatively expensive but there seemed to be lots available- we had no trouble getting them anyway. The hotel does not look very inviting from the outside (being the bottom two floors of a high rise building)but on the inside is fine. It is decorated in 'ye olde Amsterdam' style and is basic but clean. Our room was a good sized triple and we had a good sized bathroom too. One quibble was that as we were on the ground floor we couldn't open any windows and it did get quite hot at night. Aside from that the room was fine. The staff are helpful and someone is available all of the time in reception. Breakfast was ok not anything special and there did not seem to be facilities for any other meals, although we did not enquire so I may be wrong on this point. The Belfort as we experienced it is a clean basic hotel which would suit anyone in Amsterdam for a short stay who will not be spending much time in the hotel. All in all I would say that it is a good choice for anyone wishing to get a cheap hotel for a weekend and who does not mind being a little bit out from the city centre.
